label: 権帥
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: This post of Provisional Governor-General of the Government Headquarters in Kyūshū (Dazaifu) was a favorite post to grant an enemy who was to be virtually exiled from the Imperial Court in Kyōto, since it removed him completely from the central government and put him five hundred miles from the capital. [九州、太宰府]
